intro: Aldunatea gnaphalioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf cudweed, is a herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its narrow, linear leaves are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, yellowish composite flowers. Aldunatea gnaphalioides is generally low-growing, with a compact form and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions.
